ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Blade of Fiery Lamentations
ygData.msgSnippet: I dunno but many bards have reported that there s a dramatic difference between 130 dex and 100 dex.  My suspicion is that there are 10 point cutoffs that
ygData.messageBody:
I dunno but many bards have reported that there's a dramatic difference
between 130 dex and 100 dex. My suspicion is that there are 10 point
"cutoffs" that things are modified by. From personal experience 1 or 2
points never seemed to make much difference in things but whenever I do a 10
or more point jump in a stat I notice some dramatic changes. (except AGI,
it really is wasted over 100)

Just my thoughts. Again, no factual testing, just kind of an analysis from
2 years of playing.

Lyrnia Jongleur
Bard of Norrath
----- Original Message -----
From: "Elijah Meeker" <elijah@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, May 18, 2000 2:56 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Blade of Fiery Lamentations


> > 4) Increases chance of a weapon processing it's effect
> > 5) Decreases song missed note rate
>
>
> Heh, got it. So....is the increase linear or does it slow down after a
> certain point? I am still trying to see if I should pursue dex past 107,
I
> had heard that after 100 the return gets a lot less.
>
> Tszaaz
